author: chucklu
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
 Convert-TxtResourceToXml .\test.txt

```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
Convert the txt file to a file with extension .resx
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
ConvertFrom-StringData : Data line ';comment' is not in 'name=value' format.
At C:\Users\clu\source\repos\GitHub\Other\PowerShell\build.psm1:2187 char:38
+ ... esourceHashtable = ConvertFrom-StringData (Get-Content -Raw $txtFile)
+                        ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [ConvertFrom-StringData], PSInvalidOperationException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvalidOperation,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ConvertFromStringDataCommand

You cannot call a method on a null-valued expression.
At C:\Users\clu\source\repos\GitHub\Other\PowerShell\build.psm1:2188 char:17
+ ...             $resxContent = $resourceHashtable.GetEnumerator() | ForEa ...
+                 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [], RuntimeException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvokeMethodOnNull
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-rc.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0-rc.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.16299
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

I already import the latest build.psm1 to profile of my powershell.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/resources/creating-resource-files-for-desktop-apps#resources-in-text-files
The file content in test.txt contains some comment start with ";"(it seems "#" is another comment symbol)
The [Resgen.exe ](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/ccec7sz1(v=vs.100)) can handle it correctly.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Why do you need the function? We use all functions from Build.psm1 only internally fo our build process.

comments.author: chucklu
comments.body:
@iSazonov  previously I have a batch script,which using [Al.exe (Assembly Linker)](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/tools/al-exe-assembly-linker) and  [Resgen.exe (Resource File Generator)](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/tools/resgen-exe-resource-file-generator) to **generate a file with extension .resources.dll**

> 
> ResGen test.txt
> al /t:lib /culture:en-US  /embed:test.resources /out:test.resources.dll /fileversion:1.1.0.0

Now I want to embed the file version to the .resources.dll dynamically, 
It's not convenient to get the file version of test.exe by batch script, but I can get the file version by powershell script easily.
```powershell
(Get-Item ..\bin\Debug\test.exe).VersionInfo.FileVersion
```
So, I want to write a powershell script to geneate a resources.dll from a txt file(name = value format).
